The exhibition shows the traces of humanity, from their long way from the savannas, to the capital cities of the present. The main emphasis lies on the neanderthals.
Another great place to visit is the wildlife reserve not far from the museum. There are many animals including bisons, tarpans and except bullocks.
The reserve is very easy to find by foot.
The Neandertal was once a very harsh environment to live in, but today it is a very beautiful landscape with many opportunities for activities like walking and hiking.
The Neanderthals more rarely known as Neandertals, were archaic humans that became extinct about 40,000 years ago.

"The \"Feldhoffer Grotte\", where the remainings of the Neanderthal were found in 1865, got destroyed by quarrying. After new Excavations in 1997 and 2000, the worldfamous place of discovery got rebuilt in a park like fashion.
The discovery site can easily be found near the museum.
